Description: The Flight into Egypt; the Virgin and Child on a donkey facing right on a path in a wooded landscape, with five angels in a date palm bending the branches towards Joseph who reaches out for a date, and three lizards left foreground. c.1470-74 Engraving, gilded on the edges
Curator's comments: Watermark: bull's head with a star. This print was issued as a black and white facsimile by the British Museum in 'Prints and Drawings in the British Museum, Reproduced by Photographic Process', [First Series] Part III (German Prints), Published by the Trustees in 1884, where it was number XXIV and described there as 'Martin Schongauer. About 1470 - 1488.'; (Shelfmark 245*.b.14).
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (7)
Lehrs 1908-34 / Geschichte und kritische Katalog des deutschen, niederländischen und französischen Kupferstichs im XV Jahrhundert (V.62.7)
Exhibition history: 2006 Feb-June, Beijing, Capital Museum, 'BM Treasures...' 2007 Feb-June, Taipei, National Palace Museum, 'BM Treasures...' 2007 Sep-Dec, Hong Kong Museum of Art, 'BM Treasures...'
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Clayton Mordaunt Cracherode (with Philipe's oval stamp and the initials CMC visible through the backing paper)
